Subject: Cookie Trouble or Bot Trap?

X-Yahoo-Profile: molzbh

Hi,

I have run into this trouble when crawling www.compusabusiness.com

The Robots file reads

User-agent: *
Disallow: /shop
Disallow: /sales_tools

I am running a DecidingScope with SurtPrefixDecide rule. I only use one seed

http://www.compusabusiness.com/products/product_info.asp?pfp=cat3&product_code=50254374&Pn=WSR_455_Barcode_Slot_Reader_Keyboard_Wedge

as a test and the content retrieved reads:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK

Connection: close

Date: Wed, 20 Jun 2007 22:31:04 GMT

Server: Microsoft-IIS/6.0

X-Powered-By: ASP.NET

Content-Type: text/html

Expires: Tue, 19 Jun 2007 22:31:04 GMT

Set-Cookie: ASPSESSIONIDSSTRSACT=KDJIOPGAOGOLBLDMGCFFFMHP; path=/

Cache-control: private



<html><head><META HTTP-EQUIV="REFRESH" CONTENT="0;
URL=http://www.compusabusiness.com/default.asp?page=http%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Ecompusabusiness%2Ecom%2Fproducts%2Fproduct%5Finfo%2Easp%3Fpfp%3Dcat3%26product%5Fcode%3D50254374%26Pn%3DWSR%5F455%5FBarcode%5FSlot%5FReader%5FKeyboard%5FWedge">
</head></html>

Initially I thought that the site did not like the User Agent field,
here is what my user agent reads

USER AGENT:Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; heritrix/1.8.0
+http://www.business.com) but that doesnt seem to be the case.

Finally, this is  an observation related to cookies, If I disable
cookies in my browser I see a very wierd strange behavior on the URL
which keeps reloading. Of course Heritrix does not show the same
behvavior, but the issue could be related due to the

<META HTTP-EQUIV="REFRESH" CONTENT="0; which of course the browser
understands and Heritrix doesn't

I have tried to save the cookie in a file which reads:

www.compusabusiness.com FALSE   /       FALSE   ASPSESSIONIDSSTRSACT
 KDJIOPGAOGOLBLDMGCFFFMHP



Any Guidance Appreciated.

Anmol






Anmol Bhasin
Information Retrieval Software Eng.
Business.com
Redwood Shores, CA
